{{Infobox war faction | name = Khalifa Islamiyah Mindanao | native_name = | native_name_lang = | war = the [[Moro conflict]] | image = AQMI Flag asymmetric.svg | caption = [[Black Standard]] variant as used both by [[ISIL]] and the KIM | active = 2011-present | ideology = [[Islamic fundamentalism]] | leaders = [[Zulkifli Abdhir]]{{KIA}}
Amir M
Amir Abtol Rahman
Amir Kuptu
Amir Human Abdul Najid | clans = | headquarters = | area = [[Soccsksargen|Central Mindanao]], [[Philippines]] | strength = unknown | partof = | previous = | next = | allies = [[Jemaah Islamiya]]
[[Abu Sayyaf]]
[[Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters]]
Justice for Islamic Movement | split = | opponents = [[Philippines]] | battles = | url = }} '''Khalifa Islamiyah Mindanao''' ('''KIM''') is a dedicated [[Jihadism|Jihadi]] organization that seeks to establish an independent [[Islamic state]] in [[Mindanao]], [[Philippines]]. The group is led by an Afghan-trained Islamic cleric known as Humam Abdul Najid.{{cite web | last =Chalk | first =Peter | title =The Islamic State in the Philippines: A Looming Shadow in Southeast Asia? | url=https://www.ctc.usma.edu/posts/the-islamic-state-in-the-philippines-a-looming-shadow-in-southeast-asia | accessdate = 28 May 2016}} It is sometimes described as an [[umbrella organization]] composed of the [[Jemaah Islamiyah]], the [[Abu Sayyaf]], the [[Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters]], the [[Justice for Islamic Movement]] and members of other armed Islamic groups. According to the [[Philippine Institute for Peace, Violence and Terrorism Research]], the KIM had five founders; [[Zulkifli Abdhir]], who was killed on 25 January 2015 by [[Special Action Force]] officers during the raid that culminated in the [[Mamasapano clash]], Amir M, Amir Abtol Rahman, Amir Kuptu and Amir Humam Abdul Najid. The group has reportedly adopted the flag of the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]].{{cite news|last1=Medina|first1=Andrei|title=Marwan was only one of the leaders of Khalifa Islamiyah Mindanao|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/440506/news/nation/marwan-was-only-one-of-the-leaders-of-khalifa-islamiyah-mindanao|accessdate=19 February 2015|publisher=GMA News|date=18 February 2015}} [[Armed Forces of the Philippines]] chief, [[Emmanuel Bautista]] confirmed the existence of the group in August 2013, although reports about the group were made as early as two years before.{{cite news|last1=Laude|first1=Jaime|title=AFP chief confirms new militant group in South|url=http://www.philstar.com/nation/2013/08/29/1145031/afp-chief-confirms-new-militant-group-south|accessdate=19 February 2015|publisher=The Philippine Star|date=29 August 2013}}{{cite news | last =Ramos | first =Marlon | title =AFP, MILF join forces to hunt down new terror group in Mindanao | publisher =''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]'' | date = 29 August 2013 | url =http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/476661/afp-milf-join-forces-to-hunt-down-new-terror-group-in-mindanao | accessdate = 28 May 2016}} ==See also== * [[Peace process with the Bangsamoro in the Philippines]] * [[Insurgency in the Philippines]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{IslamismSEA}} {{Southern Philippines Insurgency}} {{Portal bar|War|Terrorism|Philippines}} [[Category:Jihadist groups]] [[Category:Military history of the Philippines]] [[Category:Islamism in the Philippines]] [[Category:Separatism in the Philippines]] [[Category:Secessionist organizations in Asia]] [[Category:Organizations established in 2011]]
